page.title: 03A FISHERMAN'S LIFE
page.content: The week starts on a Sunday at midnight.The partner boats set off to their fishing grounds at Flugga,at the speed of 10 knots.The journey will take approximately 21 hours.During this time there is constant contact with other boats at sea.When they reach the grounds the two boats take it in turns to shoot the net.This takes 15 minutes.The two boats stay quarter of a mile apart and start towing at a speed of three and a half knots.The fish are then brought aboard,gutted,washed and put into the fish room.This operation goes on with the crew snatching a few minutes sleep whenever they can.When all the fish are sorted out the boat is thoroughly cleaned and is scrubbed with detergent.The boat then returns home and the fish are sold at the market.
